items.item_text_raw: 1. 5:00 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 4750 San Felipe Road, San Jose, CA 95135

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.
items.item_text: Information on Public Comments and Disability Access

items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Faculty personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Article 9.20 submission and recommendation: 
Article 9.20 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all Districts assigned service during the college semester for which the y are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.   
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.20 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
			 
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 6157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District  Article 15.2.1 submission and recommendation:
			 
Article 15.2.1 Full-time unit members' overload assignment  for compensation and/or overload banking shall be based on a separate contract which shall normally be limited to 6 (six) units or 40% of a full load. Exceptions to this maximum overload shall be negotiated with the Faculty Association.
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 15.2.1 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the faculty personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:

Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of the full load.
	 
Article 9.20 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all Districts assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.  
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.20 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose-Evergreen Community College District.
	 
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 6157 and San Jose-Evergreen Community College District  Article 15.2.1 submission and recommendation:
	 
Article 15.2.1 Full-time unit members' overload assignment  for compensation and/or overload banking shall be based on a separate contract which shall normally be limited to 6 (six) units or 40% of a full load. Exceptions to this maximum overload shall be negotiated with the Faculty Association.
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 15.2.1 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose-Evergreen Community College District.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
The courses outlined in this board item are being proposed for Board of Trustee approval.
The intercollegiate and physical education courses listed are updates to existing courses and presented as new courses due to a planned discipline (name) conversion from Athletics/Physical Education to Kinesiology, Athletics and Wellness.
The journalism courses replace JOURN 035 (SJCC Times management) to better conform with Title 5 regulations regarding repeatability.
GLOBL 004A: History and Politics of a World Region - the Middle East
JOURN 035A: Introduction to Editorial Management
JOURN 035B: Development of Editorial Management Skills
JOURN 035C: Intermediate Editorial Management
JOURN 035D: Advanced Editorial Management
KIN 005:          Introduction to Kinesiology
KINPE 012:     Basketball
KINPE 042:     Swimming
KINAW 040:    Intercollegiate Softball

items.item_details:
The Ferrilli Information Group provides contracted professional services specializing in talented leaders who have experience with both the California community college governance system and the Datatel system.
	 
The District has contracted for the services of a Network Manager since fall 2007 to meet the day-to-day operating needs of the District's complex technology infrastructure and provide technology support to the colleges and the district office.  The rate going forward has been negotiated to reflect a 10% decrease in the monthly fee.
	 
In addition to the extension letter, the original agreement is provided, which contains the scope of duties and responsibilities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the extension agreement with Ferrilli Information Group to provide Network Management services at $16,650 per month for a period of 12 months, effective July 1, 2011.

items.item_details: Oral reports will be given by members of the Board of Trustees.
Oral reports will be given by Chancellor Rita Cepeda.
Oral reports will be given by the college presidents.
Oral reports will be given by the constituency representatives.

This item is being brought to the board as a "first reading" in advance of  its subsequent placement as a "second reading/action" item on the June  14, 2011  board agenda.
	 
Background - On January 25, 2011,  In accordance with BP 2745, the Board of Trustees initiated its annual self evaluation process.  Trustees Cruz, Lease and Okamura were appointed as a committee of the board to work with staff  to develop a process and criteria for evaluation.  On March 8, the committee reported on a  proposed process using  a survey methodology that would focus on two areas: (1) Board Operations and (2) Shared Accreditation Findings.  On May 10 the committee reported on the findings of the survey and proposed the development of a work plan based on the findings designed to build on the strengths of the board and to address areas of weakness.  The work plan will include include two types of actions: 
	 
1) Procedural-- changes to board process, and board operations that would result in the improvement the role and function of the board as a governing body
2) Board Development - those activities in the form of study sessions, training and other board development options to offer clarification, information and model practices and standards.
	 
In addition, it was proposed by the committee that:
the outcomes of the  2011 Board Self Evaluation process be established as a "baseline" against which to measure future progress
April 2012 be established as the date to conduct the next evaluation
An interim review of progress be conducted  in six months to gage general trends/directions
	 
Finally, the committee proposed and the board concurred, maintaining the current process of self evaluation and to continue to request feedback on board performance beyond the board members themselves by including internal constituents and representatives of the external community as well.

The purpose of this presentation is to provide a summary regarding the implementation status of the Chancellor's 2010 -2011 priorities as established by the Board of Trustees and vetted through the District's Participatory Governance process.  The presentation will also include an overview of factors impacting the work of the District and accomplishment highlights for  the 2010-2011 Academic year including the completion of three deliverables.  The presentation will conclude with recommendations for the future.
Chancellor Cepeda and Vice Chancellor Hawk will provide a budget update.
Chancellor Cepeda will provide a legislative update.

Although this item was placed on the May 10, 2011 Board of Trustees meeting agenda, this item was not reviewed due to meeting time constraints.
	 
Information will include a review of the Third Quarter Budget Report for the period ending March 31, 2011.  The state budget, current District Financial position, and estimates for FY2011/2012, FY2012/2013, and FY2013/2014 will be discussed.
	 
The Third Quarter Budget Report was provided under separate cover.  The report can also be accessed by the public on the District's web site at http://www.sjeccd.edu/business/adminservices/Pages/BudgetReports.aspx .
